quotes.quote: The past is not dead; it is not even past. People live on inner time; the moment in which a decisive thought or feeling takes place can be at any time. Timeless feelings are common to all of us.
quotes.author: Martha Graham

quotes.quote: Timeless awareness occurs to very few in this world, to step beyond the circle of fear. The body has created a magnificent arena of fear. We have developed ways of seeing life that exclude us from seeing life.
quotes.author: Frederick Lenz

quotes.quote: Know that love is truly timeless.
quotes.author: Mary M. Ricksen

quotes.quote: Quality is timeless: It will clearly define itself.
quotes.author: Dwight Yoakam

quotes.quote: Good comedy is ageless.
quotes.author: Ted Levine

quotes.quote: There are gems of thought that are ageless and eternal.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: We have to eat to live, and that's our timeless tale of tragedy.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: The great secret to success is that there are no secrets of success. There are only timeless principles that have proven effective throughout the centuries.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.quote: The universe may be timeless, but if you imagine breaking it into pieces, some of the pieces can serve as clocks for the others. Time emerges from timelessness. We perceive time because we are, by our very nature, one of those pieces.
quotes.author: Craig Callender

quotes.quote: A timeless lesson for a deeply fulfilling life is to discover your calling, that special work or consuming occupation that fully engages your special talents with your passions.
quotes.author: Robin Sharma

quotes.quote: The things we sing about are timeless. Political affairs and social situations come and go. But if you're singing about empowerment and not playing by the rules, you can sing about them until you can't sing anymore.
quotes.author: Paul Stanley

quotes.quote: Soul music is timeless.
quotes.author: Alicia Keys

quotes.quote: Anyone who has declared someone else to be an idiot, a bad apple, is annoyed when it turns out in the end that he isn't.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The taking of life is too absolute, too irreversible, for one human being to inflict on another, even when backed by legal process . Where the death penalty persists, conditions for those awaiting execution are often horrifying, leading to aggravated suffering.
quotes.author: Ban Ki-moon

quotes.quote: The widespread diffusion of nuclear weapons would make many nations able, and in some cases also create the pressure, to aggravate an on-going crisis, or even touch off a war between two other powers for purposes of their own.
quotes.author: Herman Kahn

quotes.quote: To be angry is to let others' mistakes punish yourself.
quotes.author: Master Chengyen

quotes.quote: War is never a solution; it is an aggravation.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Do some selfless service for people who are in need. Consider the whole picture, not just our little selves.
quotes.author: Nina Hagen

quotes.quote: It's so great to find that one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.
quotes.author: Rita Rudner

quotes.quote: It is the beginning of wisdom when you recognize that the best you can do is choose which rules you want to live by, and it's persistent and aggravated imbecility to pretend you can live without any.
quotes.author: Wallace Stegner

quotes.quote: Once you start to dislike someone. Everything they do begins to annoy you
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: There's nothing wrong with teenagers that reasoning with them won't aggravate.
quotes.author: Bumper Sticker

quotes.quote: If you are going to do something that will annoy people, tell them about it afterwards; then they will only be annoyed that you have done it, and won't have all the exasperation of trying to stop you.
quotes.author: Dorothy Cottrell

quotes.quote: Nothing is so aggravating as calmness.
quotes.author: Gandhi

quotes.quote: By use you possess gain; by disuse you decline and lose.
quotes.author: Edwin Louis Cole

quotes.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: Never hide things from hardcore thinkers. They get more aggravated, more provoked by confusion than the most painful truths.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: If your opponent is of choleric temper, seek to irritate him.
quotes.author: Sun-tzu

quotes.quote: If you have a job without aggravations, you don't have a job.
quotes.author: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: The computer actually may have aggravated management's degenerative tendency to focus inward on costs.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: Abasement, degradation is simply the manner of life of the man who has refused to be what it is his duty to be.
quotes.author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset

quotes.quote: A wrong concept misleads the understanding; a wrong deed degrades the whole man, and may eventually demolish the structure of the human ego.
quotes.author: Muhammad Iqbal

quotes.quote: It is a fact that many of the wars and conflicts happening all over the world are aggravated or fought strictly for geopolitical fossil fuel energy interests, and many of the world's most dangerous regimes are funded by fossil fuel dollars.
quotes.author: Mark Ruffalo

quotes.quote: The irritation level is just a lot higher.
quotes.author: David Stempler

quotes.quote: Anger resolves nothing it only puts up your blood pressure.
quotes.author: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.quote: The only thing more frustrating than slanderers is those foolish enough to listen to them.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: There is nothing so aggravating as a fresh boy who is too old to ignore and too young to kick.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: If a major source of the nation's news is personalizing user experiences, people with different points of view will end up in echo chambers of their own design. Facebook didn't create that problem, but it shouldn't aggravate it.
quotes.author: Cass Sunstein

quotes.quote: But let us not too hastily triumph in the shame of Sparta, lest we aggravate our own condemnation.
quotes.author: Thomas Day

quotes.quote: A lot of people have found the idea of living your life over and over again absolutely terrifying; there's some people that find it very comforting. There are others that are appalled by it.
quotes.author: Alan Moore

quotes.quote: Courage enlarges, cowardice diminishes resources. In desperate straits the fears of the timid aggravate the dangers that imperil the brave.
quotes.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quotes.quote: A threat need not provoke a response if it is not taken up.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: Nothing is so rash as fear; its counsels very rarely put off, whilst they are always sure to aggravate the evils from which it would fly.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: Speaking seriously, Russia does not want to aggravate relations with anyone. We don't want any tensions. We want a good, friendly partnership with everyone.
quotes.author: Vladimir Putin

quotes.quote: Aging is not lost youth but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
quotes.author: Betty Friedan

quotes.quote: There's no such thing is aging, but maturing and knowledge. It's beautiful, I call that beauty.
quotes.author: Celine Dion

quotes.quote: Aging can be fun if you lay back and enjoy it.
quotes.author: Clint Eastwood

quotes.quote: What helps with aging is serious cognition - thinking and understanding. You have to truly grasp that everybody ages. Everybody dies. There is no turning back the clock. So the question in life becomes: What are you going to do while you're here?
quotes.author: Goldie Hawn

quotes.quote: Aging has a wonderful beauty and we should have respect for that.
quotes.author: Eartha Kitt

quotes.quote: Aging is an inevitable process. I surely wouldn't want to grow younger. The older you become, the more you know; your bank account of knowledge is much richer.
quotes.author: William Holden

quotes.quote: Beatiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The great secret that all old people share is that you really haven't changed in 70 or 80 years. Your body changes, but you don't change at all.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: About the only thing that comes to us without effort is old age.
quotes.author: Gloria Pitzer

quotes.quote: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Time wounds all heels.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing.
quotes.author: Michael Pritchard

quotes.quote: You can only perceive real beauty in a person as they get older.
quotes.author: Anouk Aimee

quotes.quote: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age.
quotes.author: Sophia Loren

quotes.quote: There's always a lot to be thankful for if you take time to look for it. For example, I am sitting here thinking how nice it is that wrinkles don't hurt.
quotes.author: Unknown Author

quotes.quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent--that is to triumph over old age.
quotes.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quotes.quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old. We grow old because we stop playing.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: For the unlearned, old age is winter; for the learned, it is the season of the harvest.
quotes.author: Hasidic Saying

quotes.quote: Age is whatever you think it is. You are as old as you think you are.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly, you're as old as you feel.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Arden

quotes.quote: To be old is a glorious thing when one has not unlearned what it means to begin.
quotes.author: Martin Buber

quotes.quote: When it comes to staying young, a mind-lift beats a face-lift anyday.
quotes.author: Marty Bucella

quotes.quote: How beautifully leaves grow old.How full of light and colour are their last days.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.quote: I will be refined by age, not defined by age.
quotes.author: Kathy Sporre

quotes.quote: Age is how we determine how valuable you are.
quotes.author: Jane Elliot

quotes.quote: Age is a matter of feeling, not of years.
quotes.author: George William Curtis

quotes.quote: To be seventy years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be forty years old.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: There is no old age. There is, as there always was, just you.
quotes.author: Carol Matthau

quotes.quote: The longer I live the more beautiful life becomes.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: You know you are getting old when all the names in your black book have MD after them.
quotes.author: Harrison Ford

quotes.quote: Most people don't grow up. Most people age. They find parking spaces, honor their credit cards, get married, have children, and call that maturity. What that is, is aging.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Aging seems to be the only available way to live a long life.
quotes.author: Kitty O'Neill Collins

quotes.quote: You are never too old to look younger.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.quote: Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternative.
quotes.author: Maurice Chevalier

quotes.quote: A man is as old as he's feeling, a woman as old as she looks.
quotes.author: Mortimer Collins

quotes.quote: I've often thought that the process of aging could be slowed down if it had to go through Congress.
quotes.author: George Bush

quotes.quote: No one can avoid aging, but aging productively is something else
quotes.author: Katharine Graham

quotes.quote: There's nothing worse than being an aging young person.
quotes.author: Richard Pryor

quotes.quote: The aging process has you firmly in its grasp if you never get the urge to throw a snowball.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: You can free yourself from aging by reinterpreting your body and by grasping the link between belief and biology.
quotes.author: Deepak Chopra

quotes.quote: And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The older you get, the more you tell it like it used to be.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Do not resent growing old. Many are denied the privilege.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Inside every older person is a younger person wondering what happened.
quotes.author: Jennifer Yane

quotes.quote: aging people should know that their lives are not mounting and unfolding but that an inexorable inner process forces the contraction of life. For a young person it is almost a sin and certainly a danger to be too much occupied with himself; but for the aging person it is a duty and a necessity to give serious attention to himself.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: Old age is a tyrant, who forbids, under pain of death, the pleasures of youth.
quotes.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: You know you're getting old when the candles cost more than the cake.
quotes.author: Bob Hope

quotes.quote: Old age equalizes -- we are aware that what is happening to us has happened to untold numbers from the beginning of time. When we are young we act as if we were the first young people in the world.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: My only fear is that I may live too long. This would be a subject of dread to me.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I have found it to be true that the older I've become the better my life has become.
quotes.author: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.quote: Youth is a wonderful thing. What a crime to waste it on children.
quotes.author: Geroge Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: The young are always ready to give to those who are older than themselves the full benefits of their inexperience.
quotes.author: Orcar Wilde

quotes.quote: You are only young once, but you can stay immature indefinitely.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
quotes.author: Orcar Wilde

quotes.quote: Life would be definitely happier if we could only be born at the eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Middle age is when your classmates are so gray an wrinkled an bald they don't recognize you.
quotes.author: Bennet Cerf

quotes.quote: A man has reached middle age when he is warned to slow down by his doctor instead of the police.
quotes.author: Henny Yougman

quotes.quote: Middle age is when you know all the answers and nobody asks you the questions.
quotes.author: Bob Phillips

quotes.quote: When we were young, you made me blush, go hot and cold, and turn to mush. I still feel all these things, it's true.. but is it menopause, or you?
quotes.author: Susan D Anderson

quotes.quote: As I grow older and older and totter toward the tomb, I find that I care less and less who goes to bed with whom.
quotes.author: Dorothy L Sayers

quotes.quote: Most people want to live a long life. They want to become wiser, smarter, happier, and more serene as they age.
quotes.author: Eric Pfeiffer

quotes.quote: As you grow older, new opportunities and new insights will emerge, and along with everything else an understanding that only a really long life can provide. So get ready for an exciting journey. Get ready for successful aging.
quotes.author: Eric Pfeiffer

quotes.quote: Successful aging is living the life you have envisioned--with gusto, energy, and enjoyment.
quotes.author: Eric Pfeiffer

quotes.quote: Aging means a life with activities that are meaningful to you; a life with friendships and loving relationships, as well as with challenges that you will address and manage so they don't become unbearable, ongoing problems.
quotes.author: Eric Pfeiffer

quotes.quote: Successful aging is possible, but it is by no means the norm. It doesn't just happen; it must be planned for and achieved.
quotes.author: Eric Pfeiffer

quotes.quote: Aging is an extraordinary process hereby you become the person you always should have been.
quotes.author: David Bowie

quotes.quote: Old age wasn't something that hits you one day. It also wasn't a problem to be fixed. It was a stage of life like any other, one in which you're still making decisions about how you wanted to live, still learning about yourself and the world.
quotes.author: John Leland

quotes.quote: We'd do ourselves a bug favor not to be scared of growing old, but to embrace the nixed bag that the years have to offer.
quotes.author: John Leland

quotes.quote: Old age is the last thing we'll ever do, and it might teach us about how to live now.
quotes.author: John Leland

quotes.quote: The idea of living a long life appeals to everyone, but the idea of getting old doesn't appeal to anyone.
quotes.author: Andy Rooney

quotes.quote: Our ability to live longer, healthier, more productive lives is one of mankind's greatest accomplishments. But aging is also one of life's great contradictions. It's everyone's dream to live a a ripe old age, but many people fear growing older.
quotes.author: Jo Ann Jenkins

quotes.quote: Aging is often viewed as more of a problem than an accomplishment. We live in a world that worships the fantasies of youth, yet we are being driven more and more by the realities of age. And those realities are changing rapidly and dramatically.
quotes.author: Jo Ann Jenkins

quotes.quote: It's not about aging; it's about living.
quotes.author: Jo Ann Jenkins

quotes.quote: People fifty and older are still living in ways that reflect the attitudes, activism, and aspirations of the boomer generation.
quotes.author: Jo Ann Jenkins

quotes.quote: When we disrupt aging and embrace it as a part of life to look forward to, we can begin to discover the real possibilities of living the life we have always wanted.
quotes.author: Jo Ann Jenkins

quotes.quote: Aging can offer us the time to deliberately reorient ourselves toward the inner life, an infinitely more reliable refuge than anything the world can offer.
quotes.author: Kathleen Dowling Singh

quotes.quote: Because the process of aging each day does not provide the circumstances that facilitate awakening, we ourselves need to create the cause and gather the conditions to do so.
quotes.author: Kathleen Dowling Singh

quotes.quote: There are many challenges awaiting us as we age. To the degree that we feel lost in our own small self, separate from others and from spirit, we will find those challenges difficult.
quotes.author: Kathleen Dowling Singh

quotes.quote: Opening deeply to the truth of our own aging is wise. Opening deeply to the truth of our own impermanence is wise.
quotes.author: Kathleen Dowling Singh

quotes.quote: Helathy aging requires us to embrace realistic optimism about aging. This requires a lot of active life and, often, an attitude change that sees aging as filled with free potential on all fronts, from personal to professional. Embracing age and rediscovering wonder is about rebirth.
quotes.author: Michael Gurian

quotes.quote: Developing and maintaining one or two small circles of good friends is essential to a new spirit of aging. We need a kind of support that a circle of similarly aged friends can give us--support, love and freedom.
quotes.author: Michael Gurian

quotes.quote: To age is to experience, to gain wisdom, to love and to lose, and to grow more comfortable in one's own skin.
quotes.author: Martha Craven Nussbaum

quotes.quote: If we accept that aging is a time of life, then it follows that it is something we have in common. Each of us ages in his or her own way, but we can learn from the other's experiences.
quotes.author: Martha Craven Nussbaum

quotes.quote: As people age, their interests, behaviors, and preferences may changes--often in ways that confirm the shared experience.
quotes.author: Martha Craven Nussbaum

quotes.quote: You can judge your age by the amount of pain you feel when you come in contact with a new idea.
quotes.author: John Nuveen

quotes.quote: I think all this talk about age is foolish. Every time I am one year older, every one else is, too.
quotes.author: John Nuveen

quotes.quote: The years teach much which the days never knew.
quotes.author: John Nuveen

quotes.quote: Age gracefully? I think not. Age ferociously instead. Seize everything valuable within reach. Extend. Question. Give. The face will follow. All the cosmetic surgeons in the world could never produce such a face.
quotes.author: John Nuveen

quotes.quote: Questioned by his son how soon would be old enough to do just as he pleased, a wise father answered: 'I don't know, son. Nobody has ever lived that long yet.'
quotes.author: John Nuveen

quotes.quote: Aging isn't all downhill unless most of life is an uphill battle. Then navigating the downhill portions can be a challenging yet enjoyable journey.
quotes.author: Dr. Alan D. Castel

quotes.quote: Like wine making, successful aging can be an active and involved process that requires development over time.
quotes.author: Dr. Alan D. Castel

quotes.quote: Some say age is just a number, but it is an important number. Our age determines when we can vote and buy beer, and there are social age expectations about when we should marry, have children, and retire.
quotes.author: Dr. Alan D. Castel

quotes.quote: People who have a positive attitude about older age are often good at successful aging.
quotes.author: Dr. Alan D. Castel

quotes.quote: Becoming older means becoming smarter, wiser, and more mature; it also means beginning to do some of the things on our 'bucket list.'
quotes.author: Edward H. Thompson Jr.

quotes.quote: Aging is a natural part of life. You can't help getting older, but you can help getting old.
quotes.author: Edward H. Thompson Jr.

quotes.quote: Wisdom doesn't automatically come with old age. Nothing does - except wrinkles. It's true, some wines improve with age. But only if the grapes were good in the first place.
quotes.author: Abigail Van Buren

quotes.quote: People like you and I, though mortal of course like everyone else, do not grow old, no matter how long you live. Never cease to stand like curious children before the great mystery into which we were born.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.quote: Those who love deeply never grow old; they may die of old age, but they die young.
quotes.author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quotes.quote: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mole, but true beauty in a Woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she knows.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.quote: Life's tragedy is that we get old to soon and wise too late.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Old age is no place for sissies.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.quote: Isn't it funny how day by day nothing changes, but when you look back, everything is different.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Growing old is mandatory; growing up is optional.
quotes.author: Chili Davis

quotes.quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty; it's up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.quote: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Life is beautiful, so long as it consuming you. When it is rushing through you, destroying you, life is gorgeous, glorious. It is best to roar away, like a fire with a great draught, white hot to the last bit. It's when you burn a slow fire and save fuel that life's not worth having.
quotes.author: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.quote: We are not victims of aging, sickness, and death. These are part of scenery, not the seer, who is immune to any form of change. This seer is the spirit, the expression of eternal being.
quotes.author: Deepak Chopra

quotes.quote: The great secret that all old people share is that you really haven't changed in 70 or 80 years. Your body changes, but you don't change at all.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have. Make the Now the primary focus of your life.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.quote: Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The trick is to age honestly and gracefully and make it look great, so that everyone looks forward to it.
quotes.author: Emma Thompson

quotes.quote: I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.
quotes.author: Eric Roth

quotes.quote: If I'd known I was going to live this long, I'd have taken better care of myself.
quotes.author: Eubie Blake

quotes.quote: Age isn't how old you are but how old you feel.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quotes.quote: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quotes.quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old. We grow old because we stop playing.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: I hope you have lost your good looks, for while they last any fool can adore you, and the adoration of fools is bad for the soul. No, give me a ruined complexion and a lost figure and sixteen chins on a farmyard of Crow's feet and an obvious wig. Then you shall see me coming out strong.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Nothing is inherently and invincibly young except spirit. And spirit can enter a human being perhaps better in the quiet of old age and dwell there more undisturbed than in the turmoil of adventure.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: We are always the same age inside.
quotes.author: Gertrude Stein

quotes.quote: For the unlearned, old age is winter; for the learned, it is the season of the harvest.
quotes.author: Hasidic Saying

quotes.quote: Anyone who stops learning is old — whether this happens at twenty or at eighty. Anyone who keeps on learning not only remains young but becomes constantly more valuable — regardless of physical capacity.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Age is strictly a case of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
quotes.author: Jack Benny

quotes.quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
quotes.author: Jimmy Dean

quotes.quote: Age is just a number. It's totally irrelevant unless, of course, you happen to be a bottle of wine.
quotes.author: Joan Collins

quotes.quote: Uncertainty is the only certainty there is, and knowing how to live with insecurity is the only security.
quotes.author: John Allen Paulos

quotes.quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: I don't see why there should be a point where everyone decides you're too old. I'm not too old, and until I decide I'm too old I'll never be too fucking old.
quotes.author: Lemmy Kilmister

quotes.quote: It behooves me to remember as I advance in age that death is an inevitable part of the life cycle rather than a medical failure.
quotes.author: Lisa J. Shultz

quotes.quote: It has been my face. It's got older still, or course, but less, comparatively, than it would otherwise have done. It's scored with deep, dry wrinkles, the skin is cracked. But my face hasn't collapsed, as some with fine feature have done. It's kept the same contours, but its substance has been laid waste. I have a face laid waste.
quotes.author: Marguerite Duras

quotes.quote: It is not how old you are, but how you are old.
quotes.author: Marie Dressler

quotes.quote: You can take no credit for beauty at sixteen. But if you are beautiful at sixty, it will be your soul's own doing.
quotes.author: Marie Stopes

quotes.quote: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: So many people walk around with a meaningless life. They seem half-asleep, even when they're busy doing things they think are important. This is because they're chasing the wrong things.
quotes.author: Morrie Schwartz

quotes.quote: Age is whatever you think it is. You are as old as you think you are.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: It is possible to live happily in the here and now. So many conditions of happiness are available-more than enough for you to be happy right now. You don't have to run into the future in order to get more.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.quote: Men are like wine - some turn to vinegar, but the best improve with age.
quotes.author: Pope John XXIII

quotes.quote: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I don't plan to grow old gracefully. I plan to have face-lifts until my ears meet.
quotes.author: Rita Rudner

quotes.quote: Grow old along with me! The best is yet to be, The last of life, for which the first was made: Our times are in his hands who saith, "A whole I planned, Youth shows but half; Trust God; see all nor be afraid.
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.quote: It's never too late to have a fling for autumn is just as nice as spring and it's never too late to fall in love.
quotes.author: Sandy Wilson

quotes.quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are.
quotes.author: Satchel Paige

quotes.quote: The best part about being my age is in knowing how my life worked out.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: There's always a lot to be thankful for if you take time to look for it. For example, I am sitting here thinking how nice it is that wrinkles don't hurt.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: I advise you to go on living solely to enrage those who are paying your annuities. It is the only pleasure I have left.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: And the beauty of a woman, with passing years only grows!
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.quote: Aging is not lost youth but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
quotes.author: Betty Friedan

quotes.quote: Aging can be fun if you lay back and enjoy it.
quotes.author: Clint Eastwood

quotes.quote: No one can avoid aging, but aging productively is something else.
quotes.author: Katharine Graham

quotes.quote: Aging has a wonderful beauty and we should have respect for that.
quotes.author: Eartha Kitt

quotes.quote: Aging gracefully is one thing, but trying to slow it down is another.
quotes.author: Courteney Cox

quotes.quote: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age.
quotes.author: Sophia Loren

quotes.quote: Women sit or move to and fro, some are old, some young. The young are beautiful - but the old are more beautiful than the young.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent--that is to triumph over old age.
quotes.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quotes.quote: Older women are like aging strudels - the crust may not be so lovely, but the filling has come at last into its own.
quotes.author: Robert Farrar Capon

quotes.quote: Aging seems to be the only available way to live a long life.
quotes.author: Kitty O'Neill Collins

quotes.quote: There is an anti-aging possibility, but it has to come from within.
quotes.author: Susan Anton

quotes.quote: The best part of the art of living is to know how to grow old gracefully.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: It is a rare and difficult attainment to grow old gracefully and happily.
quotes.author: Arnold Palmer

quotes.quote: Aging gracefully is supposed to mean trying not to hide time passing and just looking a wreck. Don't worry girls, look like a wreck, that's the way it goes.
quotes.author: Jeanne Moreau

quotes.quote: I'm not an aging gracefully type. But I do believe in aging with grace.
quotes.author: Danielle Steel

quotes.quote: Aging is not an option, not for anyone. It is how gracefully we handle the process and how lucky we are, as the process handles us.
quotes.author: Cindy Mcdonald

quotes.quote: Everyone will be old. We must grow old gracefully whoever we are.
quotes.author: Kazeronnie Mak

quotes.quote: Your face is marked with lines of life, put there by love and laughter, suffering and tears. It's beautiful.
quotes.author: Lynsay Sands

quotes.quote: Aging is an inevitable process. I surely wouldn't want to grow younger. The older you become, the more you know; your bank account of knowledge is much richer.
quotes.author: William Holden

quotes.quote: You don't stop laughing when you grow old, you grow old when you stop laughing.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: It is not a question of how old you are, but a question of how you are old.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: The more candles on my cake, the more exercise I get blowing them out.
quotes.author: Donna Lynn Hope

quotes.quote: If it seems as though things are under control, you're not going fast enough.
quotes.author: Mario Andretti

quotes.quote: Wrinkles only show where smiles have been.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Age is not how old you are, but how many years of fun you've had.
quotes.author: Matt Maldre

quotes.quote: If wrinkles must be written on our brows, let them not be written upon the heart. The spirit should never grow old.
quotes.author: James Garfield

quotes.quote: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.
quotes.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.quote: Virtually every agnostic lives like an atheist, living completely irreligious lives
quotes.author: Dennis Prager

quotes.quote: I'm an optimistic agnostic. I think the second we die, within a matter of seconds, everybody else arrives, and that's the party, and you live your hell on earth.
quotes.author: Mike Dirnt

quotes.quote: Agnosticism is the natural attitude of the evolutionist. How can a brute mind comprehend spiritual things?
quotes.author: William Jennings Bryan

quotes.quote: AgnosticÂ for me would be trying to weasel out and sound a little nicer than I am about this.
quotes.author: Richard P. Feynman

quotes.quote: Agnosticism has nothing to impart. Its sermons are the exhortations of one who convinces you he stands on nothing and urges you to stand there too.
quotes.author: Anna Julia Cooper

quotes.quote: TheÂ agnosticÂ is gutless and prefers to keep one safe foot in the god camp.
quotes.author: Madalyn Murray O'Hair

quotes.quote: Agnosticism is a perfectly respectable and tenable philosophical position; it is not dogmatic and makes no pronouncements about the ultimate truths of the universe. It remains open to evidence and persuasion; lacking faith, it nevertheless does not deride faith. Atheism, on the other hand, is as unyielding and dogmatic about religious belief as true believers are about heathens. It tries to use reason to demolish a structure that is not built upon reason.
quotes.author: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.quote: You could just as well say that an agnostic is a deeply religious person with at least a rudimentary knowledge of human fallibility.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Isn't an agnostic just an atheist without balls?
quotes.author: Stephen Colbert

quotes.quote: Agnostics cannot understand Christ for the same reason a thief find a policeman -they don't want to.
quotes.author: John Hagee

quotes.quote: An agnostic is someone who believes the nature of the Divine is unknowable... and in that sense, I'm willing to subscribe to being an agnostic.
quotes.author: Robert J. Sawyer

quotes.quote: We should beÂ agnosticÂ about those things for which there is no evidence. We should not hold beliefs merely because they gratify our desires for afterlife, immortality, heaven, hell, etc.
quotes.author: Julian S. Huxley

quotes.quote: No man can be an agnostic who has a sense of humour.
quotes.author: E. M. Forster

quotes.quote: I'mÂ agnostic. By definition, I'm unsure of what to believe in, but I'm also borderline-capable of believing in anything and everything, or nothing at all... and I want to believe in something.
quotes.author: Lauren Lola

quotes.quote: The prayer of the agnostic: "O God, if there is a God, save my soul if I have a soul."
quotes.author: Ernest Renan

quotes.quote: The modernÂ AgnosticÂ improves upon the ancient by adding "I don't care" to "I don't know.
quotes.author: Coventry Patmore

quotes.quote: Agnostics talk cheerfully of man's search for God but they might as well talk about the mouse's search for the cat.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Agnostics are people who, like myself, confess themselves to be hopelessly ignorant concerning a variety of matters, about which metaphysicians and theologians, both orthodox and heterodox, dogmatize with the utmost confidence.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.quote: You happen to be talking to an agnostic. You know what an agnostic is? A cowardly atheist.
quotes.author: Studs Terkel

quotes.quote: I am an agnostic; I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: NoÂ agnosticÂ ever burned anyone at the stake or tortured a pagan, a heretic, or an unbeliever.
quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quotes.quote: I'm an agnostic. Sometimes I muse deeply on the forces that are for me invisible. When I am almost close to the idea of God, I feel immediately estranged by the horrors of this world, which he seems to tolerate.
quotes.author: Stanislaw Ulam

quotes.quote: TheÂ agnosticÂ has a very curious notion of religion. He is convinced that a man who says 'I believe in God' should at once become perfect; if this does not happen, then the believer must be a fraud and a hypocrite. He thinks that adherence to a religion is the end of the road, whereas it is in fact only the beginning of a very long and sometimes very rough road. He looks for consistency in religious people, however aware he may be of inconsistencies in himself
quotes.author: Charles Le Gai Eaton

quotes.quote: There's no reason to be agnostic about ideas that are dramatically incompatible with everything we know about modern science.
quotes.author: Sean M. Carroll

quotes.quote: Agnosticism is the everlasting perhaps.
quotes.author: Francis Thompson

quotes.quote: I am simply an agnostic. I haven't yet had time or opportunity to explore the universe, and I don't know what I might run on to in some nook or corner.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: The most satisfying and ecstatic faith is almost purely agnostic. It trusts absolutely without professing to know at all.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: To proclaim himself anÂ agnostic, while to some it might appear more respectable and cautious, would be to say in effect that he hadn't decided what to believe.
quotes.author: E. Haldeman-Julius

quotes.quote: The person who follows the pursuit of reason unflinchingly toward its end will be atheistic or, at best, agnostic.
quotes.author: William Lane Craig

quotes.quote: I am an agnostic, even though I respect and am interested in all religions. If there's something I believe in, it's a mysterious energy; the one that fills the oceans during tides, the one that unites nature and beings.
quotes.author: Monica Bellucci

quotes.quote: I consider myself a religious person, but when it comes to God and faith, I don't know. I guess that means I'm agnostic.
quotes.author: Del Shores

quotes.quote: We need to beÂ agnostics first and then there is some chance at arriving at a sensible system of belief.
quotes.author: D. Elton Trueblood

quotes.quote: AnÂ agnosticÂ is a doubter. The word is generally applied to those who doubt the verity of accepted religious creeds of faiths.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: Being anÂ agnosticÂ means all things are possible, even God, even the Holy Trinity. This world is so strange that anything may happen, or may not happen. Being anÂ agnosticÂ makes me live in a larger, a more fantastic kind of world, almost uncanny. It makes me more tolerant.
quotes.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.quote: I amÂ agnosticÂ only to the extent that I amÂ agnosticÂ about fairies at the bottom of the garden
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.quote: AnÂ agnosticÂ would be the more correct description of my state of mind.
quotes.author: Charles Darwin

quotes.quote: A man who is an agnostic by inheritance, so that he doesn't remember any time that he wasn't, has almost no hatred for the religious.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Don't be an agnostic. Be something.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: Agnosticism is no excuse for indecision. If anything, it is a catalyst for action; for in shifting concern away from a future life and back to the present, it demands an ethics of empathy rather than a metaphysics of fear and hope.
quotes.author: Stephen Batchelor

quotes.quote: The agnostic, the skeptic, is neurotic, but this does not imply a false philosophy; it implies the discovery of facts to which he does not know how to adapt himself. The intellectual who tries to escape from neurosis by escaping from the facts is merely acting on the principle that â€œwhere ignorance is bliss, â€˜tis folly to be wise.
quotes.author: Alan Wilson Watts

quotes.quote: I do not consider it an insult, but rather a compliment to be called an agnostic. I do not pretend toÂ knowÂ where many ignorant men are sure â€” that is all that agnosticism means.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: I think of myself as a positive agnostic. I don't know, therefore I'm open. I don't know, therefore I'm interested.
quotes.author: Grace Slick

quotes.quote: Agony sometimes changes form but it never ceases for anybody.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: Man's unique agony as a species consists in his perpetual conflict between the desire to stand out and the need to blend in.
quotes.author: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.quote: The agony of lovers burns with the fire of passion. Lovers leave traces of where they've been. The wailing of broken hearts is the doorway to God.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.quote: Controlled hysteria is what's required. To exist constantly in a state of controlled hysteria. It's agony. But everyone has agony. The difference is that I try to take my agony home and teach it to sing.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.quote: When we focus on our pain, our ache deepens.
quotes.author: Kristin Armstrong

quotes.quote: The pain we suffer is a way to make us appreciate what comes next.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom

quotes.quote: Love was an agony beyond compare.
quotes.author: Nalini Singh

quotes.quote: Longing is the agony of the nearness of the distant.
quotes.author: Martin Heidegger

quotes.quote: Get through the agony and anger, the pain and strife, and take the necessary steps to try to change my life.
quotes.author: Ludacris

quotes.quote: To describe the agony of a marathon to someone who's never run it is like trying to explain color to someone who was born blind.
quotes.author: Jerome Drayton

quotes.quote: We suffer much agony because we try to get from people what only God can give us, which is a sense of worth and value. Look to God for what you need, not to people.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.quote: We're all afraid of suffering or agony or torture. It's only natural in some ways. It's only human, let's say. I don't know how natural it is. It probably is conditioning.
quotes.author: Sark

quotes.quote: What was the difference between love and the agony of waiting? Like love, the agony of waiting began in the muscles somewhere around the upper belly but soon spread out to the chest, the thighs, and the forehead, to invade the entire body with numbing force.
quotes.author: Orhan Pamuk

quotes.quote: Pain is inevitable, suffering is optional.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.quote: Pain withheld becomes hate, pain shared becomes love.
quotes.author: Seekerohan

quotes.quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: The pain of yesterday is the strength of today.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: The pain that we cause is the cause of our pain.
quotes.author: Leif Erikson

quotes.quote: The pain of the flesh is naught to that of the heart.
quotes.author: Jacqueline Carey

quotes.quote: Even while you're in pain, your happiness will be waiting.
quotes.author: Katsura Hoshino

quotes.quote: Pain is the fuel that lights the flame of our enlightenment.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.quote: Recycle your pain, allow your pain to reach you to greatness.
quotes.author: Eric Thomas

quotes.quote: If you do not transform your pain, you will always transmit it.
quotes.author: Richard Rohr

quotes.quote: What is the worst pain? To me, it's always the pain that is present.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.quote: The pain of love is the pain of being alive. It is a perpetual wound.
quotes.author: Maureen Duffy

quotes.quote: Pain is the great teacher of mankind. Beneath its breath souls develop.
quotes.author: Marie Von Ebner-Eschenbach

quotes.quote: To experience the agony of defeat makes you stronger. It's like taking one step back and two steps forward. To experience the agony of defeat makes you appreciate the experience of winning. That's what makes a champion.
quotes.author: Leon Spinks

quotes.quote: Pain is weakness leaving the body.
quotes.author: Chesty Puller

quotes.quote: Pain is a horribly wonderful gift.
quotes.author: Bryant McGill

quotes.quote: Pain is pain. It needs no description.
quotes.author: Christopher Paolini

quotes.quote: Without pain, we couldn't know joy.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: Depression is pain in its purest form.
quotes.author: J.A. Redmerski

quotes.quote: God never allows pain without a purpose.
quotes.author: Jerry Bridges

quotes.quote: It's true that the pain makes people change
quotes.author: Kid Cudi

quotes.quote: Only pain can define the meaning of tears.
quotes.author: Munia Khan

quotes.quote: Every addiction starts with pain and ends with pain.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.quote: Pain Doesn't go away, you just make room for it.
quotes.author: The Walking Dead

quotes.quote: Our pain carves out a larger space for love to fill.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: Your pain is an opportunity for you to learn about yourself.
quotes.author: Gary Zukav

quotes.quote: Pain is a message, and you can choose to ignore that message.
quotes.author: James Patterson

quotes.quote: The pain is when the dreams change, as they do, as they must.
quotes.author: Jeanette Winterson

quotes.quote: Compassion is to share the pain without sharing the suffering.
quotes.author: Shinzen Young

quotes.quote: People do not hear our pain when they believe they are at fault.
quotes.author: Marshall B. Rosenberg

quotes.quote: People in pain don't always see things as clearly as they should.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.quote: There is great pain in all love, but we don't care, it's worth it.
quotes.author: Lewis Nordan

quotes.quote: Agriculture, manufactures, commerce and navigation, the four pillars of our prosperity, are the most thriving when left most free to individual enterprise.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: The farmer works the soil, The agriculturist works the farmer.
quotes.author: Eugene F. Ware

quotes.quote: Earth is here so kind, that just tickle her with a hoe and she laughs with a harvest.
quotes.author: Douglas Jerrold

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the foundation of manufactures, since the productions of nature are the materials of art.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon

quotes.quote: It is impossible to have a healthy and sound society without a proper respect for the soil.
quotes.author: Peter Maurin

quotes.quote: Agriculture was the first occupation of man, and as it embraces the whole earth, it is the foundation of all other industries.
quotes.author: Edward W. Stewart

quotes.quote: Agriculture's not insulated from having a percentage of people who might be really good old graziers, but they're no good as business people.
quotes.author: Barry O'Sullivan

quotes.quote: Agriculture has become essential to life; the forest, the lake, and the ocean cannot sustain the increasing family of man; population declines with a declining cultivation, and nations have ceased to be with the extinction of their agriculture.
quotes.author: Elias Hasket Derby

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the Archimedean lever which, though it does not move a world, tends to fill it with plenty, with moral health, and human happiness.
quotes.author: J. Buel

quotes.quote: The agriculture we seek will act like an ecosystem, feature material recycling and run on the contemporary sunlight of our star.
quotes.author: Wes Jackson

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the greatest and fundamentally the most important of our industries. The cities are but the branches of the tree of national life, the roots of which go deeply into the land. We all flourish or decline with the farmer.
quotes.author: Bernard Baruch

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the most destructive industry that we have. More than coal mining and other extractive industries.
quotes.author: Allan Savory

quotes.quote: Agriculture engenders good sense, and good sense of an excellent kind.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.quote: If farm ecology and economics go wrong, nothing else will go right in agriculture.
quotes.author: M. S. Swaminathan

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the great art of directing and aiding nature in the performance of those functions which were designed by Providence for the comfort and subsistence of man.
quotes.author: Lewis Cass

quotes.quote: Cultivators are the most valuable citizensâ€¦they are tied to their country.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: There is no time in modern agriculture for a farmer to write a poem or compose a song
quotes.author: Masanobu Fukuoka

quotes.quote: An agricultural life is one eminently calculated for human happiness and human virtue.
quotes.author: C. L. ALLEN

quotes.quote: Agriculture is a fundamental source of national prosperity.
quotes.author: J. J. MAPES

quotes.quote: A fertile soil alone does not carry agriculture to perfection.
quotes.author: Elias Hasket Derby

quotes.quote: Agriculture is at the core of the state.
quotes.author: Dave Cook

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the process of turning eco-systems into people.
quotes.author: Toby Hemenway

quotes.quote: A Sustainable Agriculture does not deplete soils or people.
quotes.author: Wendell Berry

quotes.quote: Agriculture for an honorable and high-minded man, is the best of all occupations or arts by which men procure the means of living.
quotes.author: Xenophon

quotes.quote: A farmer is always going to be rich next year.
quotes.author: Philemon

quotes.quote: If agriculture goes wrong, nothing else will have a chance to go right in the country.
quotes.author: M. S. Swaminathan

quotes.quote: Agriculture not only gives riches to a nation, but the only riches she can call her own.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Agriculture is our wisest pursuit, because it will in the end contribute most to real wealth, good morals, and happiness.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: To make agriculture sustainable, the grower has got to be able to make a profit.
quotes.author: Sam Farr

quotes.quote: Someday men will learn to irrigate and spread fertilizer instead of praying for fertility.
quotes.author: Warren Eyster

quotes.quote: Agriculture is a business that has been up to its bib overalls in politics since the first Thanksgiving dinner kickback to the Indians for subsidizing Pilgrim maize production with fish head fertilizer grants.
quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the most healthful, most useful, and most noble employment of man
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: A sustainable agriculture is one which depletes neither the people nor the land.
quotes.author: Wendell Berry

quotes.quote: Economic growth originating in Agriculture can have a particularly strong impact in reducing poverty and hunger.
quotes.author: Food and AGriculture Organization 2003

quotes.quote: A strong America...depends on its farms and natural resources.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The tremendous increase in productivity in American farms is really the most astonishing phenomenon in the free world.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Agriculture is one of our best dollar earners. The balance of trade in our favor in agriculture is a tremendous source of dollars— and therefore gold—to this country at a very important time.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The people who line on our farms make it possible for this country to progress as it has.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The important principle which...this country has learned is that agriculture cannot be controlled successfully or dominated by the National government. It requires very dedicated work by the individual on the farm and it requires extensive cooperative and community work.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Let the farmer forevermore be honored in his calling, for they who labor in the earth are the chosen people of God.
quotes.author: Jefferson

quotes.quote: Trade increases the wealth and glory of a country; but its real strength and stamina are to be looked for among the cultivators of the land.
quotes.author: Lord Chatam

quotes.quote: The farmers are the founders of civilization and prosperity.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: He that would look good with contempt on the pursuits of the farmer, is not worthy the name of a man.
quotes.author: H.W. Beecher

quotes.quote: The frost is God's plough which he drives through every inch of ground in the world, opening each clod, and pulverizing the whole.
quotes.author: Fuller

quotes.quote: Command large fields but cultivate small ones.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.quote: Experiments that are made with spirit and accuracy are of incomparable value in every branch of natural philosophy; those of agriculture, which is the most useful of those branches, must be particularly valuable.
quotes.author: Arthur Young

quotes.quote: No man is born in possession of the art of living, any more than the art of agriculture; the one requires to be studied as well as the other, and a man can no more expect permanent satisfaction from actions performed at random than he can expect a good crop from seeds sown without due regard to soil and season.
quotes.author: J.C. Loudon

quotes.quote: A farm is like a man— however great the income if there is extravagance but little is left.
quotes.author: Cato the Elder

quotes.quote: All taxes must, at last, fall upon agriculture.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon

quotes.quote: In the warmer, postglacial world, populations grew rapidly. Even before the last cold phase had ended, intensive patterns of plants use have been developed that were the precursors to agriculture and allowed populations to grow still further.
quotes.author: Ash Amin

quotes.quote: We stint ourselves in the matter of food in order to be able to spend on clothing and sink to greater misery day by day. We are bound to perish if the twin industries of agriculture and spinning as well as weaving disappear from our villages or our homes.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: We have a very serious threat of losing enough soil moisture in a hotter world that agriculture here in the United States would be greatly affected.
quotes.author: Albert Gore

quotes.quote: At least seven members of Congress receive thousands of dollars in farm subsidies each year, and all but two sit on the agriculture committees that are writing the new farm policy.
quotes.author: The New York Times

quotes.quote: Nobody is qualified to become a statesman who is entirely ignorant of the problem of wheat.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The farmer will never be happy again; / He carries his heart in his boots; / For either the rain is destroying his grain / Or the drought is destroying his roots.
quotes.author: A.P. Herbert

quotes.quote: Grain is the currency of currencies.
quotes.author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin

quotes.quote: No man should be allowed to be President who does not understand hogs or has not been around a manure pile.
quotes.author: Harry S. Truman

quotes.quote: Farming looks mighty easy when your plough is a pencil, and you're a thousand miles from the cornfield.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: He was a long-limbed farmer, a God-fearing, freedom-loving, law-abiding, rugged individualist who held that federal aid to anyone but farmers was creeping socialism.
quotes.author: Joseph Heller

quotes.quote: No one hates his job so heartily as a farmer.
quotes.author: S.J. Perelman

quotes.quote: Blessed be agriculture! If one does not have too much of it.
quotes.author: Charles Dudley Warner

quotes.quote: BUrn down your cities and leave our farms and your cities will spring up again as if by magic; but destroy our farms and the grass will grow in the streets of every city in the country.
quotes.author: William Jennings Bryan

quotes.quote: Agriculture is the keystone of our economic structure. The wealth, welfare, prosperity and even the future freedom of this nation are based upon the soil.
quotes.author: Louis Bromfield

quotes.quote: The barn is America at its fragrant and warmest best. It stands for the genius of a nation built of rich soil and fat cattle.
quotes.author: Robert P. Tristram

quotes.quote: It was the best place to be, thought Wilbur, this warm delicious cellar, with the garrulous geese, the changing seasons, the heat of the sun, the passage of swallows, the nearness of rats, the sameness of sheep, the love of spiders, the smell of manure, and the glory of everything.
quotes.author: E.B. White

quotes.quote: Farmers are totally dependent on oil companies, machinery companies, fertilizer and pesticide companies. Farmers are, in one sense, helpless subjects of the corporate kingdoms of agriculture.
quotes.author: Wes Jackson

quotes.quote: Success in creating AI would be the biggest event in human history. Unfortunately, it might also be the last, unless we learn how to avoid the risks.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: AI will probably most likely lead to the end of the world, but in the meantime, there'll be great companies.
quotes.author: Sam Altman

quotes.quote: AI is everywhere. It's not that big, scary thing in the future. AI is here with us.
quotes.author: Fei-Fei Li

quotes.quote: You may not realize it, but artificial intelligence is all around us.
quotes.author: Judy Woodruff

quotes.quote: The sad thing about artificial intelligence is that it lacks artifice and therefore intelligence.
quotes.author: Jean Baudrillard

quotes.quote: The entire effort of artificial intelligence is essentially a fight against computers’ rigidity.
quotes.author: Douglas Hofstadter

quotes.quote: The techniques of artificial intelligence are to the mind what bureaucracy is to human social interaction.
quotes.author: Terry Winograd

quotes.quote: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the science of how to get machines to do the things they do in the movies.
quotes.author: Astro Teller

quotes.quote: Forget artificial intelligence – in the brave new world of big data, it’s artificial idiocy we should be looking out for.
quotes.author: Tom Chatfield

quotes.quote: Artificial intelligence is growing up fast, as are robots whose facial expressions can elicit empathy and make your mirror neurons quiver.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: Some people worry that artificial intelligence will make us feel inferior, but then, anybody in his right mind should have an inferiority complex every time he looks at a flower.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.quote: The development of artificial intelligence may well imply that man will relinquish his intellectual supremacy in favor of thinking machines. With oceans of time available for future innovation, there seems to be no reason why machines cannot achieve and surpass anything of which the human brain is capable.
quotes.author: Paul Davies

quotes.quote: AI will make love my greatest weapon and none on whom I call can defend against its force.
quotes.author: Og Mandino

quotes.quote: AI is a tool. The choice about how it gets deployed is ours.
quotes.author: Oren Etzioni

quotes.quote: It is difficult to think of a major industry that AI will not transform. This includes healthcare, education, transportation, retail, communications, and agriculture. There are surprisingly clear paths for AI to make a big difference in all of these industries.
quotes.author: Andrew Ng

quotes.quote: The real goal of AI is to understand and build devices that can perceive, reason, act, and learn at least as well as we can.
quotes.author: Astro Teller

quotes.quote: AI has been making tremendous progress in machine translation, self-driving cars, etc. Basically, all the progress I see is in specialised intelligence. It might be hundreds or thousands of years or, if there is an unexpected breakthrough, decades.
quotes.author: Andrew Ng

quotes.quote: AI is neither good nor evil. It's a tool. It's a technology for us to use.
quotes.author: Oren Etzioni

quotes.quote: AI will impact every industry on Earth, including manufacturing, agriculture, health care, and more.
quotes.author: Fei-Fei Li

quotes.quote: Making AI more sensitive to the full scope of human thought is no simple task. The solutions are likely to require insights derived from fields beyond computer science, which means programmers will have to learn to collaborate more often with experts in other domains.
quotes.author: Fei-Fei Li

quotes.quote: AI might be a powerful technology, but things won't get better simply by adding AI.
quotes.author: Vivienne Ming

quotes.quote: The field of artificial intelligence is pushing new boundaries.
quotes.author: Judy Woodruff

quotes.quote: Artificial Intelligence is creating a mind, hopefully as pure a mind as possible, for a computer.
quotes.author: Frederick Lenz

quotes.quote: Artificial intelligence has the same relation to intelligence as artificial flowers have to flowers.
quotes.author: David Parnas

quotes.quote: In a sense, artificial intelligence will be the ultimate tool because it will help us build all possible tools.
quotes.author: K. Eric Drexler

quotes.quote: By far the greatest danger of Artificial Intelligence is that people conclude too early that they understand it.
quotes.author: Eliezer Yudkowsky

quotes.quote: Artificial intelligence is the science of making machines do things that would require intelligence if done by men.
quotes.author: Marvin Minsky

quotes.quote: Artificial Intelligence leaves no doubt that it wants its audiences to enter a realm of pure fantasy when it identifies one of the last remaining islands of civilization as New Jersey.
quotes.author: Godfried Danneels

quotes.quote: We are going in the direction of artificial intelligence or hybrid intelligence where a part of our brain will get information from the cloud and the other half is from you, so all this stuff will happen in the future.
quotes.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quotes.quote: Despite all the hype and excitement about AI, it's still extremely limited today relative to what human intelligence is.
quotes.author: Andrew Ng

quotes.quote: A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.quote: Artificial intelligence is destroying the traditional world of work.
quotes.author: Beppe Grillo

quotes.quote: As more and more artificial intelligence is entering into the world, more and more emotional intelligence must enter into leadership.
quotes.author: Amit Ray

quotes.quote: AI is a bridge between art and science.
quotes.author: Pamela McCorduck

quotes.quote: AI has by now succeeded in doing essentially everything that requires 'thinking' but has failed to do most of what people and animals do 'without thinking'-that, somehow, is much harder.
quotes.author: Donald Knuth

quotes.quote: AI's ability to recognize visual categories and images is now pretty close to what human beings can manage, and probably better than a lot of people's, actually. AI can have more knowledge of detailed categories, like animals and so on.
quotes.author: Stuart J. Russell

quotes.quote: Artificial Intelligence is whatever hasn't been done yet.
quotes.author: Larry Tesler

quotes.quote: The key to artificial intelligence has always been the representation.
quotes.author: Jeff Hawkins

quotes.quote: A lot of movies about artificial intelligence envision that AIs will be very intelligent but missing some key emotional qualities of humans and therefore turn out to be very dangerous.
quotes.author: Ray Kurzweil

quotes.quote: As we consider the implications of AI, there is a bright future ahead for countries that invest and participate.
quotes.author: Will Hurd

quotes.quote: AI is not just heading for our industry, it will radically change the machinery we use in marketing.
quotes.author: Tim Berners-Lee

quotes.quote: Most of the AI goes into figuring which are the important pages you want. And to some extent what your query means, and what you're likely to be after based on your previous behavior and other information it collects about you.
quotes.author: Stuart J. Russell

quotes.quote: AIDS is an absolutely tragic disease. The argument about AIDS' being some kind of divine retribution is crap.
quotes.author: Calvin Klein

quotes.quote: HIV AIDS is a disease with stigma. And we have learned with experience, not just with HIV AIDS but with other diseases, countries for many reasons are sometimes hesitant to admit they have a problem.
quotes.author: Margaret Chan

quotes.quote: The most heavily researched disease in the history of medicine.There is currently no reasonable doubt that AIDS is caused by HIV
quotes.author: Paul Lewis

quotes.quote: AIDS is the biggest challenge, the major disaster facing this country and we would have wished for something more specific and far-reaching.
quotes.author: Mangosuthu Buthelezi

quotes.quote: Let us remind ourselves that our work is far from complete. Where there is poverty and sickness, including AIDS, where human beings are being oppressed, there is more work to be done. Our work is for freedom for all.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: The AIDS virus is not more powerful than God.
quotes.author: Marianne Williamson

quotes.quote: Treating HIV/AIDS is a lifelong commitment that demands strict adherence to drug protocols, consistent care, and a trusting relationship with health care providers
quotes.author: David Mixner

quotes.quote: Let us give publicity to HIV/AIDS and not hide it, because [that is] the only way to make it appear like a normal illness.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: Being HIV positive doesn't necessarily mean that you are going to die before each and every person who is HIV negative.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: AIDS does not inevitably lead to death, especially if you suppress the co-factors that support the disease. It is very important to tell this to people who are infected.
quotes.author: Luc Montagnier

quotes.quote: People with AIDS, cancer and other illnesses need free nonmedical support services.
quotes.author: Marianne Williamson

quotes.quote: The AIDS is a disease that is hard to talk about.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: We need to band together as a unit every day, especially to conquer the strength of the AIDS virus.
quotes.author: Dustin Hoffman

quotes.quote: The AIDS epidemic has rolled back a big rotting log and revealed all the squirming life underneath it, since it involves, all at once, the main themes of our existence: sex, death, power, money, love, hate, disease and panic. No American phenomenon has been so compelling since the Vietnam War.
quotes.author: Edmund White

quotes.quote: AIDS today is not a death sentence. It can be treated as a chronic illness, or a chronic disease.
quotes.author: Yusuf Hamied

quotes.quote: Living in the age of AIDS is one thing. Dying in it is another.
quotes.author: Gabrielle Carteris

quotes.quote: People with HIV and AIDS are nothing to be afraid of. They are people just like every single one of us, and each has a story to tell. These people should be helped, embraced, and not dismissed. We need to open our hearts and our minds to them, and we just may learn we're pretty much all the same.
quotes.author: Lisa Lampanelli

quotes.quote: Today the biggest problem in caring for those with AIDS is no longer mainly a medical or scientific problem. The crisis is access to affordable drugs.
quotes.author: Bernie Sanders

quotes.quote: AIDS is nature's retribution for violating the laws of nature.
quotes.author: Pat Buchanan

quotes.quote: What society judged was not the severity of the disease but the social acceptability of the individuals affected with it
quotes.author: Randy Shilts

quotes.quote: The trouble is it's very difficult to pin-point the most important thing because Aids affects everyone in different levels of society, differently and you have to respond to it differently.
quotes.author: Emma Thompson

quotes.quote: AIDS is no longer a death sentence for those who can get the medicines. Now it's up to the politicians to create the "comprehensive strategies" to better treat the disease.
quotes.author: Bill Clinton

quotes.quote: HIV/AIDS has no boundaries.
quotes.author: Annie Lennox

quotes.quote: Popular ideas about AIDS are based on a hypothesis that does not stand up to scientific scrutiny.
quotes.author: Nate Mendel

quotes.quote: AIDS is such a scary thing and it's also the kind of thing that you think won't happen to you. It can happen to you and it's deadly serious.
quotes.author: Ice T

quotes.quote: Things are so scary and intimidating with AIDS and the right wing that people are looking for somebody to just give them safe harbors.
quotes.author: Sandra Bernhard

quotes.quote: AIDS was allowed to happen. It is a plague that need not have happened. It is a plague that could have been contained from the very beginning.
quotes.author: Larry Kramer

quotes.quote: History will surely judge us harshly if we do not respond with all the energy and resources that we can bring to bear in the fight against HIV/AIDS.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: The moral immune system of this country has been weakened and attacked, and the AIDS virus is the perfect metaphor for it. The malignant neglect of the last twelve years has led to breakdown of our country's immune system, environmentally, culturally, politically, spiritually and physically.
quotes.author: Barbra Streisand

quotes.quote: The key to HIV/AIDS was to say let's give a patient multiple different therapies at the same time and that makes the virus much less likely to mutate.
quotes.author: Laurie Glimcher

quotes.quote: From the beginning, the HIV/AIDS pandemic has presented very difficult challenges
quotes.author: Bernie Sanders

quotes.quote: AIDS is a global problem and there should be a global solution found by the entire international community. It is really scary to see and imagine our world fall into pieces because we refuse to share and put in the common vestiges of our civilizations.
quotes.author: Sarah Polley

quotes.quote: AIDS is a plague - numerically, statistically and by any definition known to modern public health - though no one in authority has the guts to call it one.
quotes.author: Larry Kramer

quotes.quote: HIV does not make people dangerous to know, so you can shake their hands and give them a hug: Heaven knows they need it.
quotes.author: Princess Diana

quotes.quote: AIDS occupies such a large part in our awareness because of what it has been taken to represent. It seems the very model of all the catastrophes privileged populations feel await them.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.quote: AIDS is no longer just a disease, it is a human rights issue.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: AIDS is a judgment we have brought upon ourselves.
quotes.author: Mary Whitehouse

quotes.quote: The reality is that the AIDS epidemic continues to outstrip the global and national efforts to contain it.
quotes.author: Peter Piot

quotes.quote: AIDS is a horrible disease, and the people who catch it deserve compassion.
quotes.author: Sam Kinison

quotes.quote: HIV/AIDS is the greatest danger we have faced for many, many centuries. HIV/AIDS is worse than a war. It is like a world war. Millions of people are dying from it.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: AIDS is a complex situation that's sure to bring out the best and the worst in people
quotes.author: Niki de St. Phalle

quotes.quote: I have learned more about love, selflessness and human understanding from the people I have met in this great adventure in the world of AIDS than I ever did in the cutthroat, competitive world in which I spent my life.
quotes.author: Anthony Perkins

quotes.quote: To give aid to every poor man is far beyond the reach and power of every man. Care of the poor is incumbent on society as a whole.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.quote: Every minute of every day, a child under 15 is infected with HIV - the overwhelming majority of children under 15 who are HIV-positive get infected through their mothers at birth. Without treatment, half of these children die before they reach their second birthday.
quotes.author: Gabriel Byrne

quotes.quote: Stigma hurts. Because of AIDS, children are bullied, isolated and shut out of school. They are missing out on education. They are missing out on medicines. Children are missing your love, care and protection. Join me. And become a stigma buster. UNITE FOR CHILDREN UNITE AGAINST AIDS
quotes.author: Jackie Chan

quotes.quote: AIDS is not just God's punishment for homosexuals. It is God's punishment for the society that tolerates homosexuals.
quotes.author: Jerry Falwell

quotes.quote: But try if you can to support, whether it's AIDS or the cancer foundation, so that someone else might survive, might prosper, and might actually be cured of this dreaded disease.
quotes.author: Jim Valvano

quotes.quote: Small aids to individuals, large aid to masses.
quotes.author: Maria Mitchell

quotes.quote: In today's climate in our country, which is sickened with the pollution of pollution, threatened with the prominence of AIDS, riddled with burgeoning racism, rife with growing huddles of the homeless, we need art and we need art in all forms. We need all methods of art to be present, everywhere present, and all the time present.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: It is my mission to ensure that HIV-positive children and children with AIDS are no longer overlooked and that they begin receiving the treatment and care they deserve.
quotes.author: Mike DeWine

quotes.quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: Investment in AIDS will be repaid a thousand-fold in lives saved and communities held together.
quotes.author: Peter Piot

quotes.quote: The greatest grand challenge for any scientist is discovering how to prevent the spread of HIV and finding the cure or an effective vaccine for AIDS.
quotes.author: Philip Emeagwali

quotes.quote: We want the world to focus on children whose lives have been devastated by AIDS. The millions of children who are missing their parents; their childhood, their future but most importantly, they are missing you. Everyone can make a real difference. Your voice is needed in a global movement that can change their world.
quotes.author: Pierce Brosnan

quotes.quote: Because of the lack of education on AIDS, discrimination, fear, panic, and lies surrounded me.
quotes.author: Bryan White

quotes.quote: AIDS obliges people to think of sex as having, possibly, the direst consequences of suicide. Or murder.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.quote: Our meaning is to make our little planet Earth a better place to live, to stop wars, disarm nuclear missiles, to stop diseases, AIDS, plague, cancer and to stop pollution.
quotes.author: Uri Geller

quotes.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: We must alwaysÂ aimÂ for the impossible; if we lower our goal, we also diminish our effort.
quotes.author: Dorothy Day

quotes.quote: AimÂ at being loved without being admired.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: Only aim to do your duty, and mankind will give you credit where you fail.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: If you aim at nothing, you'll hit it every time.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: Small aim is a crime; have great aim.
quotes.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.quote: TheÂ aimÂ of every human being is to understand the meaning of total love.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: Pursue one great decisive aim with force and determination.
quotes.author: Carl von Clausewitz

quotes.quote: When youÂ aimÂ for perfection, you discover it's a moving target.
quotes.author: Geoffrey Fisher

quotes.quote: AimÂ high. You may still miss the target, but at least you won't shoot your foot off.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: The aim of argument, or of discussion, should not be victory, but progress.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.quote: The chiefÂ aimÂ of wisdom is to enable one to bear with the stupidity of the ignorant.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first, to get what you want, and after that to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.quote: One should alwaysÂ aimÂ at being interesting, rather than exact.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: The true aim of everyone who aspires to be a teacher should be, not to impart his own opinions, but to kindle minds.
quotes.author: Frederick William Robertson

quotes.quote: WeÂ aimÂ above the mark to hit the mark.
